newsitem.title: USA: Strike deadline passes in Ford, UAW talks.
newsitem.headline: Strike deadline passes in Ford, UAW talks.

text.p: A midnight deadline passed with no strike as bargainers for Ford Motor Co and the United Auto Workers continued contract negotiations, but a formal extension of the current pact was not granted, union officials said.
"They told us to keep people working, but there's been no formal extension," said Jerry Klein, president of UAW Local 249 in Kansas City, Mo. "We're just sitting in the prairie waiting."
